message.content:
cs.NI, cs.RO, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.MA 

Reasoning: The paper deals with the problem of high accuracy localization of mobile nodes in a multipath-rich environment, which is a common problem in the field of networked systems and robotics. The use of a peer-to-peer framework and analytical graphical model framework based on particle filtering suggests that the paper may belong to the sub-categories of cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) and cs.RO (Robotics). The paper also addresses design questions related to the number of anchors and line-of-sight measurements needed for achieving a specified target accuracy, which suggests that it may belong to the sub-categories of cs.IT (Information Theory) and cs.SY (Systems and Control). Finally, the use of the Cramer-Rao Lower Bound (CRLB) for characterizing the performance improvement in localization accuracy suggests that the paper may also belong to the sub-category of cs.MA (Multi-Agent Systems).
